scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Let not the hours of this ungodly day

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Wear out the day in peace; but, ere sunset,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Set armed discord 'twixt these perjured kings!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Hear me, O, hear me!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: AUSTRIA
line: Lady Constance, peace!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: War! war! no peace! peace is to me a war

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O Lymoges! O Austria! thou dost shame

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: That bloody spoil: thou slave, thou wretch, thou coward!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Thou little valiant, great in villany!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Thou ever strong upon the stronger side!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Thou Fortune's champion that dost never fight

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: But when her humorous ladyship is by

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: To teach thee safety! thou art perjured too,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And soothest up greatness. What a fool art thou,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: A ramping fool, to brag and stamp and swear

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Upon my party! Thou cold-blooded slave,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Hast thou not spoke like thunder on my side,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Been sworn my soldier, bidding me depend

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Upon thy stars, thy fortune and thy strength,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And dost thou now fall over to my fores?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Thou wear a lion's hide! doff it for shame,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And hang a calf's-skin on those recreant limbs.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: AUSTRIA
line: O, that a man should speak those words to me!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And hang a calf's-skin on those recreant limbs.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: AUSTRIA
line: Thou darest not say so, villain, for thy life.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And hang a calf's-skin on those recreant limbs.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: We like not this; thou dost forget thyself.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Here comes the holy legate of the pope.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Hail, you anointed deputies of heaven!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: To thee, King John, my holy errand is.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: I Pandulph, of fair Milan cardinal,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And from Pope Innocent the legate here,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Do in his name religiously demand

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Why thou against the church, our holy mother,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: So wilfully dost spurn; and force perforce

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Keep Stephen Langton, chosen archbishop

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Of Canterbury, from that holy see?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: This, in our foresaid holy father's name,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Pope Innocent, I do demand of thee.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: What earthy name to interrogatories

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Can task the free breath of a sacred king?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Thou canst not, cardinal, devise a name

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: So slight, unworthy and ridiculous,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: To charge me to an answer, as the pope.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Tell him this tale; and from the mouth of England

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Add thus much more, that no Italian priest

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Shall tithe or toll in our dominions;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: But as we, under heaven, are supreme head,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: So under Him that great supremacy,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Where we do reign, we will alone uphold,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Without the assistance of a mortal hand:

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: So tell the pope, all reverence set apart

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: To him and his usurp'd authority.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Brother of England, you blaspheme in this.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Though you and all the kings of Christendom

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Are led so grossly by this meddling priest,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Dreading the curse that money may buy out;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: And by the merit of vile gold, dross, dust,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Purchase corrupted pardon of a man,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Who in that sale sells pardon from himself,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Though you and all the rest so grossly led

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: This juggling witchcraft with revenue cherish,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Yet I alone, alone do me oppose

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Against the pope and count his friends my foes.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Then, by the lawful power that I have,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Thou shalt stand cursed and excommunicate.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And blessed shall he be that doth revolt

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: From his allegiance to an heretic;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And meritorious shall that hand be call'd,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Canonized and worshipped as a saint,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: That takes away by any secret course

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Thy hateful life.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O, lawful let it be

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: That I have room with Rome to curse awhile!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Good father cardinal, cry thou amen

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: To my keen curses; for without my wrong

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: There is no tongue hath power to curse him right.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: There's law and warrant, lady, for my curse.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And for mine too: when law can do no right,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Let it be lawful that law bar no wrong:

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Law cannot give my child his kingdom here,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: For he that holds his kingdom holds the law;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Therefore, since law itself is perfect wrong,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: How can the law forbid my tongue to curse?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Philip of France, on peril of a curse,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Let go the hand of that arch-heretic;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And raise the power of France upon his head,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Unless he do submit himself to Rome.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
line: Look'st thou pale, France? do not let go thy hand.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Look to that, devil; lest that France repent,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And by disjoining hands, hell lose a soul.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: AUSTRIA
line: King Philip, listen to the cardinal.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And hang a calf's-skin on his recreant limbs.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: AUSTRIA
line: Well, ruffian, I must pocket up these wrongs, Because--

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Your breeches best may carry them.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Philip, what say'st thou to the cardinal?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: What should he say, but as the cardinal?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Bethink you, father; for the difference

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Is purchase of a heavy curse from Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Or the light loss of England for a friend:

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Forego the easier.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: That's the curse of Rome.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O Lewis, stand fast! the devil tempts thee here

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: In likeness of a new untrimmed bride.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: The Lady Constance speaks not from her faith,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: But from her need.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O, if thou grant my need,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Which only lives but by the death of faith,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: That need must needs infer this principle,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: That faith would live again by death of need.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O then, tread down my need, and faith mounts up;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Keep my need up, and faith is trodden down!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: The king is moved, and answers not to this.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O, be removed from him, and answer well!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: AUSTRIA
line: Do so, King Philip; hang no more in doubt.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Hang nothing but a calf's-skin, most sweet lout.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: I am perplex'd, and know not what to say.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: What canst thou say but will perplex thee more,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: If thou stand excommunicate and cursed?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Good reverend father, make my person yours,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: And tell me how you would bestow yourself.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: This royal hand and mine are newly knit,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: And the conjunction of our inward souls

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Married in league, coupled and linked together

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: With all religious strength of sacred vows;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: The latest breath that gave the sound of words

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Was deep-sworn faith, peace, amity, true love

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Between our kingdoms and our royal selves,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: And even before this truce, but new before,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: No longer than we well could wash our hands

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: To clap this royal bargain up of peace,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Heaven knows, they were besmear'd and over-stain'd

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: With slaughter's pencil, where revenge did paint

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: The fearful difference of incensed kings:

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: And shall these hands, so lately purged of blood,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: So newly join'd in love, so strong in both,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Unyoke this seizure and this kind regreet?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Play fast and loose with faith? so jest with heaven,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Make such unconstant children of ourselves,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: As now again to snatch our palm from palm,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Unswear faith sworn, and on the marriage-bed

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Of smiling peace to march a bloody host,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: And make a riot on the gentle brow

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Of true sincerity? O, holy sir,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: My reverend father, let it not be so!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Out of your grace, devise, ordain, impose

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Some gentle order; and then we shall be blest

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: To do your pleasure and continue friends.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: All form is formless, order orderless,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Save what is opposite to England's love.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Therefore to arms! be champion of our church,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Or let the church, our mother, breathe her curse,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: A mother's curse, on her revolting son.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: France, thou mayst hold a serpent by the tongue,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: A chafed lion by the mortal paw,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: A fasting tiger safer by the tooth,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Than keep in peace that hand which thou dost hold.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: I may disjoin my hand, but not my faith.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: So makest thou faith an enemy to faith;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And like a civil war set'st oath to oath,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Thy tongue against thy tongue. O, let thy vow

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: First made to heaven, first be to heaven perform'd,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: That is, to be the champion of our church!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: What since thou sworest is sworn against thyself

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And may not be performed by thyself,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: For that which thou hast sworn to do amiss

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Is not amiss when it is truly done,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And being not done, where doing tends to ill,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: The truth is then most done not doing it:

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: The better act of purposes mistook

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Is to mistake again; though indirect,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Yet indirection thereby grows direct,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And falsehood falsehood cures, as fire cools fire

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Within the scorched veins of one new-burn'd.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: It is religion that doth make vows kept;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: But thou hast sworn against religion,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: By what thou swear'st against the thing thou swear'st,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And makest an oath the surety for thy truth

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Against an oath: the truth thou art unsure

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: To swear, swears only not to be forsworn;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Else what a mockery should it be to swear!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: But thou dost swear only to be forsworn;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And most forsworn, to keep what thou dost swear.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Therefore thy later vows against thy first

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Is in thyself rebellion to thyself;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And better conquest never canst thou make

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Than arm thy constant and thy nobler parts

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Against these giddy loose suggestions:

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Upon which better part our prayers come in,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: If thou vouchsafe them. But if not, then know

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: The peril of our curses light on thee

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: So heavy as thou shalt not shake them off,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: But in despair die under their black weight.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: AUSTRIA
line: Rebellion, flat rebellion!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Will't not be?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Will not a calfs-skin stop that mouth of thine?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Father, to arms!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Upon thy wedding-day?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Against the blood that thou hast married?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: What, shall our feast be kept with slaughter'd men?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Shall braying trumpets and loud churlish drums,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Clamours of hell, be measures to our pomp?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: O husband, hear me! ay, alack, how new

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Is husband in my mouth! even for that name,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Which till this time my tongue did ne'er pronounce,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Upon my knee I beg, go not to arms

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Against mine uncle.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O, upon my knee,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Made hard with kneeling, I do pray to thee,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Thou virtuous Dauphin, alter not the doom

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Forethought by heaven!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Now shall I see thy love: what motive may

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Be stronger with thee than the name of wife?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: That which upholdeth him that thee upholds,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: His honour: O, thine honour, Lewis, thine honour!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: LEWIS
line: I muse your majesty doth seem so cold,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: LEWIS
line: When such profound respects do pull you on.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: I will denounce a curse upon his head.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Thou shalt not need. England, I will fall from thee.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O fair return of banish'd majesty!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
line: O foul revolt of French inconstancy!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: France, thou shalt rue this hour within this hour.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Old Time the clock-setter, that bald sexton Time,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Is it as he will? well then, France shall rue.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: The sun's o'ercast with blood: fair day, adieu!

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Which is the side that I must go withal?

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: I am with both: each army hath a hand;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: And in their rage, I having hold of both,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: They swirl asunder and dismember me.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Husband, I cannot pray that thou mayst win;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Uncle, I needs must pray that thou mayst lose;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Father, I may not wish the fortune thine;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Grandam, I will not wish thy fortunes thrive:

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Whoever wins, on that side shall I lose

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: Assured loss before the match be play'd.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Lady, with me, with me thy fortune lies.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: BLANCH
line: There where my fortune lives, there my life dies.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Cousin, go draw our puissance together.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: France, I am burn'd up with inflaming wrath;

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: A rage whose heat hath this condition,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: That nothing can allay, nothing but blood,

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: The blood, and dearest-valued blood, of France.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Thy rage sham burn thee up, and thou shalt turn

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: To ashes, ere our blood shall quench that fire:

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Look to thyself, thou art in jeopardy.

scene: SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: No more than he that threats. To arms let's hie!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Now, by my life, this day grows wondrous hot;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Some airy devil hovers in the sky

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And pours down mischief. Austria's head lie there,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.
speaker: BASTARD
line: While Philip breathes.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Hubert, keep this boy. Philip, make up:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: My mother is assailed in our tent,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: And ta'en, I fear.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.
speaker: BASTARD
line: My lord, I rescued her;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Her highness is in safety, fear you not:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.
speaker: BASTARD
line: But on, my liege; for very little pains

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Will bring this labour to an happy end.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: To QUEEN ELINOR  So shall it be; your grace shall

speaker: KING JOHN
line: stay behind

speaker: KING JOHN
line: So strongly guarded.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Cousin, look not sad:

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Thy grandam loves thee; and thy uncle will

speaker: KING JOHN
line: As dear be to thee as thy father was.

speaker: ARTHUR
line: O, this will make my mother die with grief!

speaker: KING JOHN
line: To the BASTARD  Cousin, away for England!

speaker: KING JOHN
line: haste before:

speaker: KING JOHN
line: And, ere our coming, see thou shake the bags

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Of hoarding abbots; imprisoned angels

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Set at liberty: the fat ribs of peace

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Must by the hungry now be fed upon:

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Use our commission in his utmost force.

speaker: BASTARD
line: Bell, book, and candle shall not drive me back,

speaker: BASTARD
line: When gold and silver becks me to come on.

speaker: BASTARD
line: I leave your highness. Grandam, I will pray,

speaker: BASTARD
line: If ever I remember to be holy,

speaker: BASTARD
line: For your fair safety; so, I kiss your hand.

speaker: ELINOR
line: Farewell, gentle cousin.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Coz, farewell.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
line: Come hither, little kinsman; hark, a word.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Come hither, Hubert. O my gentle Hubert,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: We owe thee much! within this wall of flesh

speaker: KING JOHN
line: There is a soul counts thee her creditor

speaker: KING JOHN
line: And with advantage means to pay thy love:

speaker: KING JOHN
line: And my good friend, thy voluntary oath

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Lives in this bosom, dearly cherished.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Give me thy hand. I had a thing to say,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: But I will fit it with some better time.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: By heaven, Hubert, I am almost ashamed

speaker: KING JOHN
line: To say what good respect I have of thee.

speaker: HUBERT
line: I am much bounden to your majesty.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Good friend, thou hast no cause to say so yet,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: But thou shalt have; and creep time ne'er so slow,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Yet it shall come from me to do thee good.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: I had a thing to say, but let it go:

speaker: KING JOHN
line: The sun is in the heaven, and the proud day,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Attended with the pleasures of the world,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Is all too wanton and too full of gawds

speaker: KING JOHN
line: To give me audience: if the midnight bell

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Did, with his iron tongue and brazen mouth,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Sound on into the drowsy race of night;

speaker: KING JOHN
line: If this same were a churchyard where we stand,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: And thou possessed with a thousand wrongs,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Or if that surly spirit, melancholy,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Had baked thy blood and made it heavy-thick,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Which else runs tickling up and down the veins,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Making that idiot, laughter, keep men's eyes

speaker: KING JOHN
line: And strain their cheeks to idle merriment,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: A passion hateful to my purposes,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Or if that thou couldst see me without eyes,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Hear me without thine ears, and make reply

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Without a tongue, using conceit alone,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Without eyes, ears and harmful sound of words;

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Then, in despite of brooded watchful day,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: I would into thy bosom pour my thoughts:

speaker: KING JOHN
line: But, ah, I will not! yet I love thee well;

speaker: KING JOHN
line: And, by my troth, I think thou lovest me well.

speaker: HUBERT
line: So well, that what you bid me undertake,

speaker: HUBERT
line: Though that my death were adjunct to my act,

speaker: HUBERT
line: By heaven, I would do it.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Do not I know thou wouldst?

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Good Hubert, Hubert, Hubert, throw thine eye

speaker: KING JOHN
line: On yon young boy: I'll tell thee what, my friend,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: He is a very serpent in my way;

speaker: KING JOHN
line: And whereso'er this foot of mine doth tread,

speaker: KING JOHN
line: He lies before me: dost thou understand me?

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Thou art his keeper.

speaker: HUBERT
line: And I'll keep him so,

speaker: HUBERT
line: That he shall not offend your majesty.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Death.

speaker: HUBERT
line: My lord?

speaker: KING JOHN
line: A grave.

speaker: HUBERT
line: He shall not live.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Enough.

speaker: KING JOHN
line: I could be merry now. Hubert, I love thee;

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Well, I'll not say what I intend for thee:

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Remember. Madam, fare you well:

speaker: KING JOHN
line: I'll send those powers o'er to your majesty.

speaker: ELINOR
line: My blessing go with thee!

speaker: KING JOHN
line: For England, cousin, go:

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Hubert shall be your man, attend on you

speaker: KING JOHN
line: With all true duty. On toward Calais, ho!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: So, by a roaring tempest on the flood,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: A whole armado of convicted sail

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Is scatter'd and disjoin'd from fellowship.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Courage and comfort! all shall yet go well.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: What can go well, when we have run so ill?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Are we not beaten? Is not Angiers lost?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Arthur ta'en prisoner? divers dear friends slain?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: And bloody England into England gone,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: O'erbearing interruption, spite of France?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: What he hath won, that hath he fortified:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: So hot a speed with such advice disposed,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Such temperate order in so fierce a cause,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Doth want example: who hath read or heard

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Of any kindred action like to this?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Well could I bear that England had this praise,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: So we could find some pattern of our shame.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Look, who comes here! a grave unto a soul;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Holding the eternal spirit against her will,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: In the vile prison of afflicted breath.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: I prithee, lady, go away with me.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Lo, now I now see the issue of your peace.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Patience, good lady! comfort, gentle Constance!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: No, I defy all counsel, all redress,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: But that which ends all counsel, true redress,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Death, death; O amiable lovely death!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Thou odouriferous stench! sound rottenness!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Arise forth from the couch of lasting night,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Thou hate and terror to prosperity,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And I will kiss thy detestable bones

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And put my eyeballs in thy vaulty brows

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And ring these fingers with thy household worms

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And stop this gap of breath with fulsome dust

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And be a carrion monster like thyself:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Come, grin on me, and I will think thou smilest

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And buss thee as thy wife. Misery's love,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O, come to me!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: O fair affliction, peace!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: No, no, I will not, having breath to cry:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O, that my tongue were in the thunder's mouth!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Then with a passion would I shake the world;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And rouse from sleep that fell anatomy

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Which cannot hear a lady's feeble voice,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Which scorns a modern invocation.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Lady, you utter madness, and not sorrow.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Thou art not holy to belie me so;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: I am not mad: this hair I tear is mine;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: My name is Constance; I was Geffrey's wife;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Young Arthur is my son, and he is lost:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: I am not mad: I would to heaven I were!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: For then, 'tis like I should forget myself:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O, if I could, what grief should I forget!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Preach some philosophy to make me mad,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And thou shalt be canonized, cardinal;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: For being not mad but sensible of grief,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: My reasonable part produces reason

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: How I may be deliver'd of these woes,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And teaches me to kill or hang myself:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: If I were mad, I should forget my son,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Or madly think a babe of clouts were he:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: I am not mad; too well, too well I feel

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: The different plague of each calamity.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Bind up those tresses. O, what love I note

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: In the fair multitude of those her hairs!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Where but by chance a silver drop hath fallen,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Even to that drop ten thousand wiry friends

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Do glue themselves in sociable grief,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Like true, inseparable, faithful loves,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Sticking together in calamity.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: To England, if you will.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: Bind up your hairs.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Yes, that I will; and wherefore will I do it?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: I tore them from their bonds and cried aloud

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: 'O that these hands could so redeem my son,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: As they have given these hairs their liberty!'

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: But now I envy at their liberty,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And will again commit them to their bonds,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Because my poor child is a prisoner.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And, father cardinal, I have heard you say

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: That we shall see and know our friends in heaven:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: If that be true, I shall see my boy again;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: For since the birth of Cain, the first male child,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: To him that did but yesterday suspire,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: There was not such a gracious creature born.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: But now will canker-sorrow eat my bud

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And chase the native beauty from his cheek

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And he will look as hollow as a ghost,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: As dim and meagre as an ague's fit,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: And so he'll die; and, rising so again,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: When I shall meet him in the court of heaven

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: I shall not know him: therefore never, never

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Must I behold my pretty Arthur more.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: You hold too heinous a respect of grief.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: He talks to me that never had a son.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: You are as fond of grief as of your child.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Grief fills the room up of my absent child,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Lies in his bed, walks up and down with me,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Puts on his pretty looks, repeats his words,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Remembers me of all his gracious parts,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Stuffs out his vacant garments with his form;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Then, have I reason to be fond of grief?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: Fare you well: had you such a loss as I,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: I could give better comfort than you do.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: I will not keep this form upon my head,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: When there is such disorder in my wit.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: O Lord! my boy, my Arthur, my fair son!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: My life, my joy, my food, my all the world!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CONSTANCE
line: My widow-comfort, and my sorrows' cure!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: KING PHILIP
line: I fear some outrage, and I'll follow her.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: There's nothing in this world can make me joy:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Life is as tedious as a twice-told tale

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Vexing the dull ear of a drowsy man;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: And bitter shame hath spoil'd the sweet world's taste

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: That it yields nought but shame and bitterness.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Before the curing of a strong disease,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Even in the instant of repair and health,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: The fit is strongest; evils that take leave,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: On their departure most of all show evil:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: What have you lost by losing of this day?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: All days of glory, joy and happiness.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: If you had won it, certainly you had.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: No, no; when Fortune means to men most good,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: She looks upon them with a threatening eye.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: 'Tis strange to think how much King John hath lost

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: In this which he accounts so clearly won:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Are not you grieved that Arthur is his prisoner?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: As heartily as he is glad he hath him.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Your mind is all as youthful as your blood.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Now hear me speak with a prophetic spirit;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: For even the breath of what I mean to speak

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Shall blow each dust, each straw, each little rub,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Out of the path which shall directly lead

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Thy foot to England's throne; and therefore mark.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: John hath seized Arthur; and it cannot be

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: That, whiles warm life plays in that infant's veins,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: The misplaced John should entertain an hour,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: One minute, nay, one quiet breath of rest.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: A sceptre snatch'd with an unruly hand

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Must be as boisterously maintain'd as gain'd;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And he that stands upon a slippery place

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Makes nice of no vile hold to stay him up:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: That John may stand, then Arthur needs must fall;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: So be it, for it cannot be but so.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: But what shall I gain by young Arthur's fall?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: You, in the right of Lady Blanch your wife,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: May then make all the claim that Arthur did.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: And lose it, life and all, as Arthur did.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: How green you are and fresh in this old world!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: John lays you plots; the times conspire with you;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: For he that steeps his safety in true blood

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Shall find but bloody safety and untrue.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: This act so evilly born shall cool the hearts

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Of all his people and freeze up their zeal,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: That none so small advantage shall step forth

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: To cheque his reign, but they will cherish it;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: No natural exhalation in the sky,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: No scope of nature, no distemper'd day,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: No common wind, no customed event,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: But they will pluck away his natural cause

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And call them meteors, prodigies and signs,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Abortives, presages and tongues of heaven,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Plainly denouncing vengeance upon John.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: May be he will not touch young Arthur's life,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: But hold himself safe in his prisonment.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: O, sir, when he shall hear of your approach,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: If that young Arthur be not gone already,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Even at that news he dies; and then the hearts

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Of all his people shall revolt from him

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And kiss the lips of unacquainted change

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And pick strong matter of revolt and wrath

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Out of the bloody fingers' ends of John.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Methinks I see this hurly all on foot:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And, O, what better matter breeds for you

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Than I have named! The bastard Faulconbridge

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Is now in England, ransacking the church,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Offending charity: if but a dozen French

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Were there in arms, they would be as a call

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: To train ten thousand English to their side,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Or as a little snow, tumbled about,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Anon becomes a mountain. O noble Dauphin,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Go with me to the king: 'tis wonderful

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: What may be wrought out of their discontent,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Now that their souls are topful of offence.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: For England go: I will whet on the king.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Strong reasons make strong actions: let us go:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.
speaker: LEWIS
line: If you say ay, the king will not say no.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Heat me these irons hot; and look thou stand

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Within the arras: when I strike my foot

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Upon the bosom of the ground, rush forth,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: And bind the boy which you shall find with me

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Fast to the chair: be heedful: hence, and watch.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: First Executioner
line: I hope your warrant will bear out the deed.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Uncleanly scruples! fear not you: look to't.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Young lad, come forth; I have to say with you.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Good morrow, Hubert.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Good morrow, little prince.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: As little prince, having so great a title

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: To be more prince, as may be. You are sad.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Indeed, I have been merrier.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Mercy on me!

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Methinks no body should be sad but I:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Yet, I remember, when I was in France,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Young gentlemen would be as sad as night,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Only for wantonness. By my christendom,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: So I were out of prison and kept sheep,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: I should be as merry as the day is long;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: And so I would be here, but that I doubt

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: My uncle practises more harm to me:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: He is afraid of me and I of him:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Is it my fault that I was Geffrey's son?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: No, indeed, is't not; and I would to heaven

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: I were your son, so you would love me, Hubert.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Aside  If I talk to him, with his innocent prate

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: He will awake my mercy which lies dead:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Therefore I will be sudden and dispatch.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Are you sick, Hubert? you look pale to-day:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: In sooth, I would you were a little sick,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: That I might sit all night and watch with you:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: I warrant I love you more than you do me.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Aside  His words do take possession of my bosom.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Read here, young Arthur.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: How now, foolish rheum!

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Turning dispiteous torture out of door!

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: I must be brief, lest resolution drop

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Out at mine eyes in tender womanish tears.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Can you not read it? Is it not fair writ?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Too fairly, Hubert, for so foul effect:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Must you with hot irons burn out both mine eyes?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Young boy, I must.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: And will you?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: And I will.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Have you the heart? When your head did but ache,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: I knit my handercher about your brows,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: The best I had, a princess wrought it me,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: And I did never ask it you again;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: And with my hand at midnight held your head,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: And like the watchful minutes to the hour,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Still and anon cheer'd up the heavy time,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Saying, 'What lack you?' and 'Where lies your grief?'

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Or 'What good love may I perform for you?'

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Many a poor man's son would have lien still

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: And ne'er have spoke a loving word to you;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: But you at your sick service had a prince.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Nay, you may think my love was crafty love

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: And call it cunning: do, an if you will:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: If heaven be pleased that you must use me ill,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Why then you must. Will you put out mine eyes?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: These eyes that never did nor never shall

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: So much as frown on you.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: I have sworn to do it;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: And with hot irons must I burn them out.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Ah, none but in this iron age would do it!

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: The iron of itself, though heat red-hot,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Approaching near these eyes, would drink my tears

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: And quench his fiery indignation

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Even in the matter of mine innocence;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Nay, after that, consume away in rust

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: But for containing fire to harm mine eye.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Are you more stubborn-hard than hammer'd iron?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: An if an angel should have come to me

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: And told me Hubert should put out mine eyes,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: I would not have believed him,--no tongue but Hubert's.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Come forth.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Do as I bid you do.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: O, save me, Hubert, save me! my eyes are out

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Even with the fierce looks of these bloody men.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Give me the iron, I say, and bind him here.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Alas, what need you be so boisterous-rough?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: I will not struggle, I will stand stone-still.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: For heaven sake, Hubert, let me not be bound!

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Nay, hear me, Hubert, drive these men away,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: And I will sit as quiet as a lamb;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: I will not stir, nor wince, nor speak a word,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Nor look upon the iron angerly:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Thrust but these men away, and I'll forgive you,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Whatever torment you do put me to.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Go, stand within; let me alone with him.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: First Executioner
line: I am best pleased to be from such a deed.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Alas, I then have chid away my friend!

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: He hath a stern look, but a gentle heart:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Let him come back, that his compassion may

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Give life to yours.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Come, boy, prepare yourself.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Is there no remedy?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: None, but to lose your eyes.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: O heaven, that there were but a mote in yours,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: A grain, a dust, a gnat, a wandering hair,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Any annoyance in that precious sense!

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Then feeling what small things are boisterous there,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: ARTHUR
line: Your vile intent must needs seem horrible.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Is this your promise? go to, hold your tongue.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in a castle.
