speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Hail, noble prince of France!

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: The next is this, King John hath reconciled

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Himself to Rome; his spirit is come in,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: That so stood out against the holy church,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: The great metropolis and see of Rome:

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Therefore thy threatening colours now wind up;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And tame the savage spirit of wild war,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: That like a lion foster'd up at hand,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: It may lie gently at the foot of peace,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And be no further harmful than in show.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Your grace shall pardon me, I will not back:

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: I am too high-born to be propertied,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: To be a secondary at control,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Or useful serving-man and instrument,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: To any sovereign state throughout the world.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Your breath first kindled the dead coal of wars

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Between this chastised kingdom and myself,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: And brought in matter that should feed this fire;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: And now 'tis far too huge to be blown out

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: With that same weak wind which enkindled it.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: You taught me how to know the face of right,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Acquainted me with interest to this land,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Yea, thrust this enterprise into my heart;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: And come ye now to tell me John hath made

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: His peace with Rome? What is that peace to me?

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: I, by the honour of my marriage-bed,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: After young Arthur, claim this land for mine;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: And, now it is half-conquer'd, must I back

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Because that John hath made his peace with Rome?

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Am I Rome's slave? What penny hath Rome borne,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: What men provided, what munition sent,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: To underprop this action? Is't not I

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: That undergo this charge? who else but I,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: And such as to my claim are liable,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Sweat in this business and maintain this war?

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Have I not heard these islanders shout out

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: 'Vive le roi!' as I have bank'd their towns?

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Have I not here the best cards for the game,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: To win this easy match play'd for a crown?

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: And shall I now give o'er the yielded set?

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: No, no, on my soul, it never shall be said.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: You look but on the outside of this work.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Outside or inside, I will not return

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Till my attempt so much be glorified

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: As to my ample hope was promised

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Before I drew this gallant head of war,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: And cull'd these fiery spirits from the world,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: To outlook conquest and to win renown

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Even in the jaws of danger and of death.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: What lusty trumpet thus doth summon us?

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: According to the fair play of the world,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Let me have audience; I am sent to speak:

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: My holy lord of Milan, from the king

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: I come, to learn how you have dealt for him;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And, as you answer, I do know the scope

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And warrant limited unto my tongue.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: The Dauphin is too wilful-opposite,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: And will not temporize with my entreaties;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: He flatly says he'll not lay down his arms.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: By all the blood that ever fury breathed,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: The youth says well. Now hear our English king;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: For thus his royalty doth speak in me.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: He is prepared, and reason too he should:

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: This apish and unmannerly approach,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: This harness'd masque and unadvised revel,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: This unhair'd sauciness and boyish troops,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: The king doth smile at; and is well prepared

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: To whip this dwarfish war, these pigmy arms,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: From out the circle of his territories.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: That hand which had the strength, even at your door,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: To cudgel you and make you take the hatch,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: To dive like buckets in concealed wells,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: To crouch in litter of your stable planks,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: To lie like pawns lock'd up in chests and trunks,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: To hug with swine, to seek sweet safety out

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: In vaults and prisons, and to thrill and shake

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Even at the crying of your nation's crow,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Thinking his voice an armed Englishman;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Shall that victorious hand be feebled here,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: That in your chambers gave you chastisement?

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: No: know the gallant monarch is in arms

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And like an eagle o'er his aery towers,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: To souse annoyance that comes near his nest.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And you degenerate, you ingrate revolts,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: You bloody Neroes, ripping up the womb

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Of your dear mother England, blush for shame;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: For your own ladies and pale-visaged maids

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Like Amazons come tripping after drums,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Their thimbles into armed gauntlets change,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Their needles to lances, and their gentle hearts

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: To fierce and bloody inclination.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: There end thy brave, and turn thy face in peace;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: We grant thou canst outscold us: fare thee well;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: We hold our time too precious to be spent

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: With such a brabbler.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
line: Give me leave to speak.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: No, I will speak.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: We will attend to neither.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Strike up the drums; and let the tongue of war

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Plead for our interest and our being here.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Indeed your drums, being beaten, will cry out;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And so shall you, being beaten: do but start

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: An echo with the clamour of thy drum,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And even at hand a drum is ready braced

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: That shall reverberate all as loud as thine;

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Sound but another, and another shall

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: As loud as thine rattle the welkin's ear

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And mock the deep-mouth'd thunder: for at hand,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Not trusting to this halting legate here,

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Whom he hath used rather for sport than need

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Is warlike John; and in his forehead sits

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: A bare-ribb'd death, whose office is this day

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: To feast upon whole thousands of the French.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: LEWIS
line: Strike up our drums, to find this danger out.

scene: SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And thou shalt find it, Dauphin, do not doubt.

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: How goes the day with us? O, tell me, Hubert.

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: HUBERT
line: Badly, I fear. How fares your majesty?

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: This fever, that hath troubled me so long,

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Lies heavy on me; O, my heart is sick!

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: Messenger
line: My lord, your valiant kinsman, Faulconbridge,

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: Messenger
line: Desires your majesty to leave the field

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: Messenger
line: And send him word by me which way you go.

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Tell him, toward Swinstead, to the abbey there.

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: Messenger
line: Be of good comfort; for the great supply

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: Messenger
line: That was expected by the Dauphin here,

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: Messenger
line: Are wreck'd three nights ago on Goodwin Sands.

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: Messenger
line: This news was brought to Richard but even now:

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: Messenger
line: The French fight coldly, and retire themselves.

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Ay me! this tyrant fever burns me up,

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: And will not let me welcome this good news.

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Set on toward Swinstead: to my litter straight;

scene: SCENE III.  The field of battle.
speaker: KING JOHN
line: Weakness possesseth me, and I am faint.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: I did not think the king so stored with friends.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PEMBROKE
line: Up once again; put spirit in the French:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PEMBROKE
line: If they miscarry, we miscarry too.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: That misbegotten devil, Faulconbridge,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: In spite of spite, alone upholds the day.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PEMBROKE
line: They say King John sore sick hath left the field.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Lead me to the revolts of England here.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: When we were happy we had other names.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PEMBROKE
line: It is the Count Melun.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Wounded to death.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Fly, noble English, you are bought and sold;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Unthread the rude eye of rebellion

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: And welcome home again discarded faith.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Seek out King John and fall before his feet;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: For if the French be lords of this loud day,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: He means to recompense the pains you take

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: By cutting off your heads: thus hath he sworn

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: And I with him, and many moe with me,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Upon the altar at Saint Edmundsbury;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Even on that altar where we swore to you

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Dear amity and everlasting love.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: May this be possible? may this be true?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Have I not hideous death within my view,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Retaining but a quantity of life,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Which bleeds away, even as a form of wax

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Resolveth from his figure 'gainst the fire?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: What in the world should make me now deceive,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Since I must lose the use of all deceit?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Why should I then be false, since it is true

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: That I must die here and live hence by truth?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: I say again, if Lewis do win the day,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: He is forsworn, if e'er those eyes of yours

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Behold another day break in the east:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: But even this night, whose black contagious breath

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Already smokes about the burning crest

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Of the old, feeble and day-wearied sun,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Even this ill night, your breathing shall expire,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Paying the fine of rated treachery

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Even with a treacherous fine of all your lives,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: If Lewis by your assistance win the day.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Commend me to one Hubert with your king:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: The love of him, and this respect besides,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: For that my grandsire was an Englishman,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Awakes my conscience to confess all this.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: In lieu whereof, I pray you, bear me hence

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: From forth the noise and rumour of the field,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: Where I may think the remnant of my thoughts

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: In peace, and part this body and my soul

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: MELUN
line: With contemplation and devout desires.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: We do believe thee: and beshrew my soul

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: But I do love the favour and the form

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Of this most fair occasion, by the which

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: We will untread the steps of damned flight,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: And like a bated and retired flood,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Leaving our rankness and irregular course,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Stoop low within those bounds we have o'erlook'd

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: And cabby run on in obedience

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Even to our ocean, to our great King John.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: My arm shall give thee help to bear thee hence;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: For I do see the cruel pangs of death

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Right in thine eye. Away, my friends! New flight;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: And happy newness, that intends old right.

speaker: LEWIS
line: The sun of heaven methought was loath to set,

speaker: LEWIS
line: But stay'd and made the western welkin blush,

speaker: LEWIS
line: When English measure backward their own ground

speaker: LEWIS
line: In faint retire. O, bravely came we off,

speaker: LEWIS
line: When with a volley of our needless shot,

speaker: LEWIS
line: After such bloody toil, we bid good night;

speaker: LEWIS
line: And wound our tattering colours clearly up,

speaker: LEWIS
line: Last in the field, and almost lords of it!

speaker: Messenger
line: Where is my prince, the Dauphin?

speaker: LEWIS
line: Here: what news?

speaker: Messenger
line: The Count Melun is slain; the English lords

speaker: Messenger
line: By his persuasion are again fall'n off,

speaker: Messenger
line: And your supply, which you have wish'd so long,

speaker: Messenger
line: Are cast away and sunk on Goodwin Sands.

speaker: LEWIS
line: Ah, foul shrewd news! beshrew thy very heart!

speaker: LEWIS
line: I did not think to be so sad to-night

speaker: LEWIS
line: As this hath made me. Who was he that said

speaker: LEWIS
line: King John did fly an hour or two before

speaker: LEWIS
line: The stumbling night did part our weary powers?

speaker: Messenger
line: Whoever spoke it, it is true, my lord.

speaker: LEWIS
line: Well; keep good quarter and good care to-night:

speaker: LEWIS
line: The day shall not be up so soon as I,

speaker: LEWIS
line: To try the fair adventure of to-morrow.

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.

line: I am no woman, I'll not swoon at it.

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: HUBERT
line: The king, I fear, is poison'd by a monk:

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: HUBERT
line: I left him almost speechless; and broke out

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.

line: To acquaint you with this evil, that you might

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: HUBERT
line: The better arm you to the sudden time,

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.

line: How did he take it? who did taste to him?

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Withhold thine indignation, mighty heaven,

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.

line: And tempt us not to bear above our power!

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: I'll tell tree, Hubert, half my power this night,

line: Passing these flats, are taken by the tide;

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.

line: Myself, well mounted, hardly have escaped.

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Away before: conduct me to the king;

scene: SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: It is too late: the life of all his blood

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.

line: Doth he still rage?

line: Than when you left him; even now he sung.

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: O vanity of sickness! fierce extremes

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Death, having prey'd upon the outward parts,

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.

line: Leaves them invisible, and his siege is now

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.

line: With many legions of strange fantasies,

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Which, in their throng and press to that last hold,

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.

line: Confound themselves. 'Tis strange that death

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.

line: The salt in them is hot.

line: Within me is a hell; and there the poison

line: Is as a fiend confined to tyrannize

line: And spleen of speed to see your majesty!

speaker: KING JOHN
line: Which holds but till thy news be uttered;

line: And then all this thou seest is but a clod

line: The Dauphin is preparing hitherward,

line: You breathe these dead news in as dead an ear.

line: My liege! my lord! but now a king, now thus.

line: Even so must I run on, and even so stop.

line: What surety of the world, what hope, what stay,

speaker: BASTARD

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Now, now, you stars that move in your right spheres,

speaker: BASTARD
line: Where be your powers? show now your mended faiths,

line: And instantly return with me again,

speaker: BASTARD
line: To push destruction and perpetual shame

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Out of the weak door of our fainting land.

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Straight let us seek, or straight we shall be sought;

line: The Dauphin rages at our very heels.

speaker: SALISBURY

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: He will the rather do it when he sees

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Ourselves well sinewed to our defence.

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: Nay, it is in a manner done already;

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: For many carriages he hath dispatch'd

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: To the sea-side, and put his cause and quarrel

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: To the disposing of the cardinal:

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: With whom yourself, myself and other lords,

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: If you think meet, this afternoon will post

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: To consummate this business happily.

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Let it be so: and you, my noble prince,

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: With other princes that may best be spared,

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: Thither shall it then:

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD
line: And happily may your sweet self put on

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.

line: The lineal state and glory of the land!

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: BASTARD

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
speaker: SALISBURY
line: And the like tender of our love we make,

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.

scene: SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.
